metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20241 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in ImageMagick in coders/jp2.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of math division by zero. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: imagemagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
